Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.ImbalancedClassification.ImbalancedAlgorithms.GP_COACH_H.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

    Title: Rule

    Description: Fuzzy Rule in the GP-COACH algorithm

    Company: KEEL

    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Written by Victoria Lopez (University of Granada) 19/11/2011

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule()
        Default constructor

      • Rule

        public Rule(DataBase database,
            int n_classes,
            int tnorm,
            int tconorm,
            int rule_weight)
        Constructor with parameters. It creates a random general rule
        Parameters:
        database - Data Base associated to the general rule base that includes this rule
        n_classes - Number of classes in the training set
        tnorm - T-norm used to compute the compatibility degree
        tconorm - T-conorm used to compute the compatibility degree
        rule_weight - Rule weight of the created rule

      • Rule

        public Rule(DataBase database,
            int n_classes,
            int tnorm,
            int tconorm,
            int rule_weight,
            double[] sample,
            int sample_class)
        Constructor with parameters. It creates a specific rule from a given sample
        Parameters:
        database - Data Base associated to the general rule base that includes this rule
        n_classes - Number of classes in the training set
        tnorm - T-norm used to compute the compatibility degree
        tconorm - T-conorm used to compute the compatibility degree
        rule_weight - Rule weight of the created rule
        sample - Data sample used to generate this rule
        sample_class - Output class associated to the data sample used to generate this rule

      • Rule

        public Rule(Rule original)
        Copy constructor for a Fuzzy rule from another Fuzzy Rule
        Parameters:
        original - Rule which will be used as base to create another Rule

    • Method Detail

      • not_eval

        public boolean not_eval()
        Checks if the current rule has been evaluated or not.
        Returns:
        true, if this rule was evaluated previously; false, if it has never been evaluated

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(myDataset dataset,
                     double alpha)
        Evaluates this rule, computing the raw_fitness of the rule and the weight. It also initializes the token structure for the token competition computation
        Parameters:
        dataset - Training dataset used in this algorithm
        alpha - Alpha of the raw_fitness evaluation function

      • compatibility

        public double compatibility(double[] sample,
                            boolean[] missing)
        Computes the compatibility degree of the rule with an input example. If it has missing values, the only matching possible for the rule happens when the missing value has no condition
        Parameters:
        sample - The input example
        missing - An array with the missing values for this input example
        Returns:
        the degree of compatibility

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Obtains the weight associated to this rule
        Returns:
        the weight associated to the fuzzy rule

      • getClas

        public int getClas()
        Obtains the class associated to this rule, consequent of the fuzzy rule
        Returns:
        class associated to this rule, consequent of the fuzzy rule

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Obtains the level of this rule; 1 for general rules, 2 for specific rules
        Returns:
        class associated to this rule, consequent of the fuzzy rule

        public int getnVar()
        Obtains the number of variables used in this rule antecedent

        Returns:

      • setClass

        public void setClass(int new_class,
                     int low_granularity)
        Changes the class of the rule to a new specified class. It also changes the internal values that correspond to the new class value
        Parameters:
        new_class - class that is going to be assigned to this rule
        low_granularity - number of labels that indicate low granularity for a rule

      • getVar

        public FuzzyAntecedent getVar(int i)
        Obtains the ith variable used in this rule antecedent
        Parameters:
        i - variable position we want to extract from the antecedent
        Returns:
        ith variable in this rule antecedent

      • exchangeAntecedentLabel

        public void exchangeAntecedentLabel(int pos_att_to_change,
                                    FuzzyAntecedent var,
                                    DataBase data,
                                    int low_granularity)
        Changes the antecedent labels for one condition in the antecedent to another labels in the antecedent
        Parameters:
        pos_att_to_change - position in this rule antecedent of the attribute that is going to change labels
        var - fuzzy antecedent containing the new label for the selected attribute
        data - Data Base associated to the general rule base that includes this rule
        low_granularity - number of labels that indicate low granularity for a rule

      • exchangeVariables

        public void exchangeVariables(boolean[] current_variables,
                              java.util.ArrayList<FuzzyAntecedent> new_variables,
                              int low_granularity)
        Changes the antecedent labels for one condition in the antecedent to another labels in the antecedent
        Parameters:
        current_variables - boolean array with the selected variables from this rule
        new_variables - ArrayList of FuzzyAntecedent that contains the new variables for this rule
        low_granularity - number of labels that indicate low granularity for a rule

                     DataBase data,
                     int low_granularity)
        Adds a label to the fuzzy antecedent of the given variable
        Parameters:
        variable_mutated - position of the variable that is going to have a label added
        data - Data Base associated to the general rule base that includes this rule
        low_granularity - number of labels that indicate low granularity for a rule

      • ideal

        public int ideal()
        Computes the number of training samples that match this rule and are correctly classified. The rule must have been previously evaluated
        Returns:
        the number of training samples this rule can seize and are correctly classified

      • getSeizedSamples

        public int getSeizedSamples()
        Computes the number of training samples that match this rule. The rule must have been previously evaluated
        Returns:
        the number of training samples this rule can seize

      • setPenalizedFitness

        public void setPenalizedFitness(double fitness)
        Sets the penalized fitness field to a specified given value, corresponding to this rule penalized fitness according to the data set and the other rules considered
        Parameters:
        fitness - penalized fitness value associated to this rule

      • isSeized

        public boolean isSeized(int idSample)
        Checks if a determined value of the training set is seized by this rule or not
        Parameters:
        idSample - Position in the training set of the value that we want to seize with this rule
        Returns:
        true, if the sample is seized by this rule; false, if it is not seized

      • getPenalizedFitness

        public double getPenalizedFitness()
        Obtains the penalized fitness associated to this rule, computed with the token competition procedure
        Returns:
        the penalized fitness associated to this rule

      • getGranularity

        public double getGranularity()
        Obtains the granularity of this rule as the maximum number of labels that a fuzzy antecedent can have
        Returns:
        the granularity of this rule, maximum number of labels that a fuzzy antecedent can have

      • setLocalHierarchicalMeasure

        public void setLocalHierarchicalMeasure(double measure)
        Sets the local hierarchical measure field to a specified given value, corresponding to this rule local hierarchical measure according to the data set and the other rules considered
        Parameters:
        measure - local hierarchical measure associated to this rule

      • getLocalHierarchicalMeasure

        public double getLocalHierarchicalMeasure()
        Obtains the local hierarchical measure associated to this rule, computed with the compute hierarchical measures procedure
        Returns:
        the local hierarchical measure associated to this rule

      • computeLocalHierarchicalMeasure

        public double computeLocalHierarchicalMeasure(myDataset dataset,
                                              double min_matching_degree)
        Computes the local hierarchical measure for this rule, according to the matching degree given for samples
        Parameters:
        dataset - Training dataset used in this algorithm
        min_matching_degree - Minimum compatibility degree that the rule must have with the sample to be considered as a matching sample
        Returns:
        local hierarchical measure for this rule according to the matching degree given for samples

      • containsEqualAntecedents

        public boolean containsEqualAntecedents(Rule r)
        Compares this rule with the specified rule to check if the rules have the same antecedents
        Parameters:
        r - Rule that is going to be compared with the current rule
        Returns:
        true, if the antecedents for the two rules are the same; false, otherwise

      • updateFuzzyLabels

        public void updateFuzzyLabels(double[][] granularity_tuning,
                              myDataset dataset,
                              double alpha)
        Updates the current rule according to a specified lateral tuning of the associated fuzzy labels
        Parameters:
        granularity_tuning - Lateral tuning of the associated fuzzy labels of this rule
        dataset - Training dataset used in this algorithm
        alpha - Alpha of the raw_fitness evaluation function

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object a)
        Compares this object with the specified object for order, according to the raw_fitness measure
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object
